page.title: 13INDUSTRY MAGOR BREWERY
page.content: The Magor brewery cost Whitbread over Â£52m and was originally designed to supply the rapidly expanding UK lager market.It is now able to brew both ales and lagers and is the home of Welsh Bitter.It has been designed to cater for the future:currently it can brew over 1 million barrels of beer a year,but there is sufficient potential to double output if required. The site chosen for any new brewery in South Wales had to be served by good communication routes.The 58 acre site is next to the M4,London to South Wales motorway,and near the North/South M5 route. Magor is made up of eight separate buildings,all linked by elevated walkways allowing easy access to all parts of the brewery.These walkways also carry the service pipes.
